body:
Erik, because to me it infers a stable object that's reused. It's not a major deal, though, just a minor nit.

The bigger problem is two paths to access params, how it doesn't fit with preloading, and the confusion over what's in a argument just called "user" (I would assume the actual user object, but it's the params of the user).


On Dec 24, 2012, at 10:02 AM, Erik Michaels-Ober <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> @dhh I'm not sure I understand that point. Could you please explain why you think users would expect a method with parameters to be any more long-lived than a method without parameters?
